KnowledgeBase.Title: icompareGT
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: icompare icompareEQ icompareNE icompareGE icompareLT icompareLE

Function.Description: The icompareGT is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Integer values. It returns true if the first object is greater than the second object and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The icompareGT is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Integer values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the icompareGT function when you wish to compare two Integers and determine if {int1} greater than {int2} and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Integer operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Argument.Name: int1
Argument.Note: The first Integer to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the first Integer is greater than the second Integer and false if the first Integer is lesser or equal in value than the second Integer.
